content: LIMA  Sept 30 Index provider MSCI Inc  opted on Wednesday to keep Peru's bourse in its "emerging market" group but warned it might downgrade the stock exchange to a higher-risk "frontier" status in nine months if liquidity sinks further.
name: MSCI Inc
title: UPDATE 2-MSCI to keep Peru bourse in 'emerging market' group for now

content: LIMA  Sept 30 MSCI Inc said on Wednesday it decided not to reclassify Peru's bourse as a "frontier market" from its current "emerging market" status but will reevaluate a potential downgrade to the higher-risk group next year.
name: MSCI Inc
title: MSCI says to keep Peru bourse in 'emerging market' group for now

content: LIMA  Sept 8 Peru's bourse has a "good chance" of staying in MSCI Inc's emerging market category and avoiding a downgrade to a riskier status  the bourse's general manager said on Tuesday following preliminary talks with the index provider.
name: MSCI Inc
title: Peru bourse sees 'good chance' of keeping emerging market status

content: NEW YORK U.S. index provider MSCI Inc  said on Tuesday that recent market gyrations in China and a barrage of interventions by the authorities to stop the rout will not be a factor in deciding whether to include China-listed shares in its Emerging Markets Index.
name: MSCI Inc
title: Exclusive: MSCI says volatility won't impact China 'A shares' decision

content: HONG KONG  Aug 28 U.S. index provider MSCI Inc  said it would remove Hanergy Thin Film Power Group Ltd  from its indexes as the troubled Chinese solar company's shares had not traded for a long time.
name: MSCI Inc
title: MSCI dumps troubled China solar company Hanergy from indexes

content: LIMA  Aug 19 Any downgrade of Peru's stock exchange to "frontier market" status by index provider MSCI Inc would likely trigger a capital outflow of $1.5 billion to $5 billion within three months  the head of Peru's bourse said on Wednesday.
name: MSCI Inc
title: A Peru stock exchange downgrade would likely trigger large outflows -bourse

content: HONG KONG  July 17 Hanergy Thin Film Power Group Ltd said it may launch a judicial challenge to a decision by the Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) to suspend trading in its shares  saying the halt was not in the interest of shareholders or investors.
name: MSCI Inc
title: UPDATE 1-Hanergy seeks to overturn regulator's share trading halt

content: LONDON Index provider MSCI on Tuesday asked for client feedback on whether it should follow its usual practice of waiting 40 days before taking action on Greece's stock market closure or if different treatment is justified.
name: MSCI Inc
title: Index providers MSCI  FTSE seek feedback on Greek bourse closure  capital curbs

content: LONDON  July 7 Index provider MSCI on Tuesday asked for client feedback on whether it should follow its usual practice of waiting 40 days before taking action on Greece's stock market closure or if different treatment is justified.
name: MSCI Inc
title: UPDATE 1-Index providers MSCI  FTSE seek feedback on Greek bourse closure  capital curbs

content: LONDON Index provider MSCI said on Monday that the closure of the Athens stock market and the imposition of capital controls could lead to Greece's relegation from the benchmark emerging equity index and its reclassification as a "standalone" market.
name: MSCI Inc
title: Greece controls could relegate it to 'standalone' equity market - MSCI

content: LONDON  June 19 Index provider MSCI said on Friday it was monitoring investors' access to Greek equity markets and could change the country's status from emerging markets to "standalone" if any restrictions were introduced.
name: MSCI Inc
title: MSCI could reclassify Greece "standalone" market if restrictions imposed

content: NEW YORK  June 15 Including Chinese mainland stocks in MSCI Inc's emerging markets index will have a significant impact for global investors in funds tied to the index given the weighting and volatility of the shares  a Reuters graphical data analysis shows.
name: MSCI Inc
title: GRAPHIC-China A-shares will be gamechanger for emerging market benchmark

content: NEW YORK Including Chinese mainland stocks in MSCI Inc's emerging markets index will have a significant impact for global investors in funds tied to the index given the weighting and volatility of the shares  a Reuters graphical data analysis shows (See graphic http://graphics.thomsonreuters.com/15/msci/index.html ).
name: MSCI Inc
title: China A-shares will be gamechanger for emerging market benchmark

content: NEW YORK  June 15 Including Chinese mainland stocks in MSCI Inc's emerging markets index will have a significant impact for global investors in funds tied to the index given the weighting and volatility of the shares  a Reuters graphical data analysis shows.
name: MSCI Inc
title: RPT-GRAPHIC-China A-shares will be gamechanger for emerging market benchmark

content: LONDON  June 11 MSCI's decision not to include China's A-shares in its benchmark emerging markets equity index was the right move for investors  veteran emerging markets investor Mark Mobius said on Thursday.
name: MSCI Inc
title: Templeton's Mobius says MSCI's decision on China A-shares was right

content: HONG KONG/SHANGHAI U.S. index provider MSCI Inc  has told China it must further liberalize its capital markets before it will include Chinese domestic shares in one of its global benchmarks  in a setback for Beijing's efforts to promote its currency and attract foreign capital. | Video
name: MSCI Inc
title: MSCI puts decision to include China 'A' shares in index on hold

content: HONG KONG  June 10 U.S.index provider MSCI Inc  said on Tuesday it will give investors a minimum of 12 months to prepare for China 'A' shares being included in one of its key benchmark indexes.
name: MSCI Inc
title: MSCI to give investors at least a year to prepare for China 'A' shares

content: LONDON  June 10 Chinese stocks seesawed on Wednesday  buoyed by fresh stimulus hopes but knocked by MSCI's decision not to include them in its indexes  while other emerging markets received respite from a slight pullback in the dollar.
name: MSCI Inc
title: EMERGING MARKETS-Easing dollar brings EM relief  China stocks seesaw on MSCI's No verdict

content: NEW YORK/SHANGHAI U.S. index provider MSCI Inc said on Tuesday it will hold off including China-listed shares in one of its key benchmark indexes  but expects them to be incorporated once outstanding market accessibility issues are resolved.
name: MSCI Inc
title: MSCI delays including China 'A' shares' in benchmark index

content: NEW YORK/SHANGHAI  June 9 U.S. index provider MSCI Inc said on Tuesday it will hold off including China-listed shares in one of its key benchmark indexes  but expects them to be incorporated once outstanding market accessibility issues are resolved.
name: MSCI Inc
title: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-MSCI delays including China 'A' shares' in benchmark index

content: MUMBAI Indian shares rose more than 1 percent on Wednesday with the Nifty snapping its seven-day losing streak after U.S. index compiler MSCI Inc  delayed the inclusion of Chinese domestic shares in its emerging markets index.
name: MSCI Inc
title: Nifty snaps seven-day losing streak on MSCI China A-shares delay

content: SHANGHAI  June 10 China stocks ended a volatile Wednesday session slightly lower  as investor disillusionment over MSCI's decision not to put mainland stocks in its global index and a coming tidal wave of listings dampened interest.
name: MSCI Inc
title: China stocks end a see-saw day lower after MSCI disappointment

content: NEW YORK  June 9 U.S. index provider MSCI Inc  said on Tuesday it will hold off including China A shares in one of its key benchmarks  but expects them to be included once outstanding market accessibility issues are resolved.

title: MSCI delays including China A shares for benchmark index

name: MSCI Inc
title: UPDATE 3-MSCI puts decision to include China 'A' shares in index on hold

content: SHANGHAI  June 10 China stocks opened lower on Wednesday  after U.S. index provider MSCI Inc said it would hold off including China-listed shares in one of its key benchmark indexes  citing market accessibility issues.
name: MSCI Inc
title: China stocks open down after MSCI decision to not include A shares in benchmark

content: DUBAI  May 28 Qatar's bourse fell sharply on Thursday  driven by news of criminal investigations against FIFA soccer officials as well as by profit-taking after an upgrade of some stocks by index compiler MSCI. Most other Gulf markets were also soft.
name: MSCI Inc
title: MIDEAST STOCKS-Qatar falls further on FIFA probe  MSCI profit-taking

name: MSCI Inc
title: UPDATE 2-MIDEAST STOCKS-Almarai  Ma'aden lift Saudi; Egypt slips

content: DUBAI  May 13 Gulf equities may rise on Wednesday after oil prices jumped and index compiler MSCI upgraded several stocks from the United Arab Emirates  Qatar and Saudi Arabia. But Dubai builder Arabtec could fall after an unexpected first-quarter loss.
name: MSCI Inc
title: MIDEAST STOCKS-MSCI upgrades  firmer oil may lift Gulf markets

content: DUBAI  May 14 Most Gulf stock markets rose in early trade on Thursday  led by Qatar which was supported by the inclusion of two stocks in MSCI's emerging markets index  but Dubai construction firms fell after poor first-quarter earnings.
name: MSCI Inc
title: UPDATE 1-MIDEAST STOCKS-Qatar MSCI picks extend gains; Dubai builders fall

title: MSCI to launch Saudi Arabia  GCC indexes on June 1

title: MSCI to allow overseas listings to be included in major indexes
